content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the Julia code that would fulfill your request. Note, this assumes you are using DataFrames.jl package for handling data frames.

```julia
using DataFrames

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map((x)->Dates.formatmmessayyy(x,"y"), df[:dt])
    return df
end
```

In this function, we are using the `map` function from DataFrames.jl which applies a given function to each element in the specified column of the dataframe and returns an array with the results. The anonymous function (`(x)->Dates.formatmmessayyy(x,"y")`) extracts the year and month parts from DateTime object and concatenate them into "yyyymm" format.
